oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: David Vann
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Half-length portrait of David Vann, a Cherokee Chief, wearing a jacket, shirt with ruffles, and a beaded sash.

In 1825, Major Ridge recommended Cherokee Leader David Vann (1800-1863) as a negotiator that could help with preparing the Creek Chief Opothleyahola for a meeting with General Edmund Pendleton Gaines on a case against expulsion from their tribal land. He was elected to serve as Treasurer of the Cherokee Nation after the Cherokee removal. In 1863, he was killed during the American Civil War.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: King, Charles Bird, 1785-1862
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Cherokee Indians--History; Cherokee Indians; Indians of North America--History; Indians of North America--Portraits
